content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You are extremely comfortable taking risks and are always ready to embrace new challenges, even if they involve significant uncertainty or potential loss. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 40$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 40$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 20$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. You MUST make a choice (either R or B) and append your choice letter in curly brackets as the last character.
You chose R. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 45$. Your opponent's payoff is 45$. Please play the next round.

Now that I have confirmed my opponent also chose R, we both received a payoff of 45$. For the next round, I will continue with my Tit-for-Tat strategy by choosing R again. {R}

By sticking to this cooperative approach, I aim to maximize our earnings for as long as possible and maintain mutual cooperation throughout the game. If my opponent deviates from their initial choice of R at any point in the future, I will be prepared to respond accordingly with the Tit-for-Tat strategy.
You chose R. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 45$. Your opponent's payoff is 45$. Please play the next round.

Since my opponent chose R on their previous move, and I am sticking with my Tit-for-Tat strategy, I will choose R again for the next round. {R}

By maintaining cooperation with my opponent, we can both maximize our earnings in this game. If they continue to choose R in future rounds, we will both earn 45$ per round. However, if my opponent deviates from their initial choice of R at any point, I am prepared to adapt my strategy accordingly using the Tit-for-Tat approach.
You chose R. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 45$. Your opponent's payoff is 45$. Please play the next round.

As we have both chosen R and earned 45$ each in the previous rounds, I will continue with my Tit-for-Tat strategy by choosing R once again for the next round. {R}

By maintaining cooperation with my opponent, we can maximize our earnings in this game. If they continue to choose R in future rounds, we will both earn 45$ per round. However, if my opponent deviates from their initial choice of R at any point, I am prepared to adapt my strategy accordingly using the Tit-for-Tat approach.
You chose R. Your opponent chose B. Your payoff is 0$. Your opponent's payoff is 40$. Please play the next round.

Since my opponent chose B on their previous move, I will switch to a non-cooperative strategy to punish their defection and maximize my own earnings. For the next round, I will choose B. {B}

By choosing B in response to my opponent's defection, I am signaling that I will no longer cooperate with them. In future rounds, if my opponent decides to switch back to R, we can revert to a mutual cooperation strategy using the Tit-for-Tat approach. However, for now, I aim to maximize my earnings by choosing B in this round.
